learning_outcomes.description: Integrate and apply OHS knowledge to the work situation.
Acquire practical skills that will enhance the application of existing knowledge.
Plan strategies to address and solve OHS existing or emerging issues.
Show appropriate levels of competence in the application of OHS and related skills and practice.
Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with both workers and management.
Appraise their own performance by reflective practice.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to develop a learning contract in consultation with their workplace supervisor that outlines the six OHS tasks the student will undertake during the placement. 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: This assessment is graded on a pass/fail basis, and there is no system for applying "mark" penalties. If the assessment item is not submitted by the submission due date outlined in the course profile, it will be considered a non-submission, resulting in a "fail".
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to undertake a range of OHS tasks that demonstrate their ability to apply OHS theoretical knowledge and technical/non-technical skills in practice. During the 240 hour placement, students are to complete OHS tasks and submit six (6) of these tasks during the semester. For each task, students are required to complete the OHS Task Form and upload supporting evidence to Turnitin.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task (subject to host supervisor's approval). Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: This assessment is graded on a pass/fail basis, and there is no system for applying "mark" penalties. If the assessment item is not submitted by the submission due date outlined in the course profile, it will be considered a non-submission, resulting in a "fail".
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The student's general work practices will be assessed by the host supervisor. See checklist in the assessment section of the course Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Host supervisors will forward Supervisor's reports to the course coordinator.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
UQ Orientation to OHS Placements

This session will cover course expectations, requirements and assessments.

Learning outcomes: L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: UQ Orientation to OHS Placements This session will cover course expectations, requirements and assessments.

learning_activities.topic:
Host Organisation Orientation

Students will spend Week 1 orientating themselves to their workplace, including the undertaking of compulsory induction programs and developing a learning contract.

Learning outcomes: L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Host Organisation Orientation Students will spend Week 1 orientating themselves to their workplace, including the undertaking of compulsory induction programs and developing a learning contract.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 15(03 Mar - 08 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
OHS Activity

Students will spend weeks 2 - 15 completing OHS tasks as outlined in their learning contract.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: OHS Activity Students will spend weeks 2 - 15 completing OHS tasks as outlined in their learning contract.
